Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, clean, safe, well-located”
Reviews.Author: SDMidwife
Reviews.Content: While we ended up really not liking Venice, our room was lovely, safe, well-located, and we were treated well by the manager. We did have a really hard time locating it, and after wandering around quite a while, we ended up using the expensive cell minutes to call and have someone meet us. The shower was hot, the beds were so-so but good enough for traveling, and the price was as good as it gets for budget in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “All about the location”
Reviews.Author: LizzieBHalifax
Reviews.Content: We stayed there summer 2009 and it's great, as long as you know what to expect. We stayed in the actual Residenza Favaro, which is down a little tiny alley and there is no reception or facilities at the building - just rooms. That's fine - if you know that. The room was tired and we were a little worried about using the electrical sockets - but despite all of that it's brilliant because of where it is. It's a short two min stroll to Saint Mark's Square - right on the poshest street in Venice with all the designer shops. Find the Bulgari jewellery shop, and you're there (well, down an alley). Views non existent, but you can get air in the room. It's nice a dark, so fairly cool (marble stairs keep it all cool too). Be prepared to firstly locate the premises, then you ring the bell and they either direct you to the other hotel where there is a reception - or a chap will come and meet you in five minutes. You might have to traipse to the other hotel to sort out paperwork etc. If you turn up to Venice with heavy suitcases - you're going to struggle - pack light, there's a lot of walking from any ferry stops and there's plenty of bridges with steps.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise!!”
Reviews.Author: parakerry
Reviews.Content: Had booked in to Residenza Favaro for 3 nights. When we arrived, there was a note on the door to ring regarding the booking, which we did, and a gentleman arrived very quickly to inform us that there was no accommodation at Favaro but had organised another apartment for us. The apartment was just over the bridge from Hotel Ala, who also own Favaro, and it was fabulous! Bathroom was big, shower wonderful! Two things that would have completed my stay.....tea and coffee making facilities, and WiFi! Will remember this apartment for my future trips to Venice....Residenza Ae Ostreghe!

Reviews.Title: “wish i knew.”
Reviews.Author: abigail t
Reviews.Content: THis hotel looked wonderful but unfortunatly they moved us to a different hotel down the way which, unfortunatly was tiny and not very nice. my advice.... dont book here because they will screw you. we still had to pay the same price for a crappy room.

Reviews.Title: “Surprsingly quiet for being so close to St Mark's Square”
Reviews.Author: NeverGonnaRoughIt
Reviews.Content: We had a positive experience at Residenza Favaro; our room was very clean and very spacious (we actually had a two floor loft). It was in a great location, just steps from St Mark's square and within walking distance to everything we wanted to see or do in Venice. Like many things in Venice, it is not especially easy to find. And this actual property is not attached to a hotel proper. It is definitely more like renting someone's apartment than staying in a hotel--there was no front desk or staff to go to for question, recommendations, etc. On the plus side, it was surprisingly quiet for being in such a busy area.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay in a surprising gem!”
Reviews.Author: leftmyheartinbergen
Reviews.Content: We booked in to Residenza Favaro a little while ago, and were asked to check in at the nearby Hotel Ala on arrival. When we were collected to be taken to our room and what a fantastic surprise! We entered into a doorway just metres from the Grand Canal (Giglio stop). I don't know how long the hotel will be like this, because we were put in a new property that is still being renovated before opening. According to our host, Residenza Favaro is no longer and this was going to be their new hotel. It was clean, airy and spacious with fantastic facilities and free Wifi as well. Everything was made easy for us and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. I would recommend this hotel to all of my friends (though I can't actually remember its new name!). Only one problem that might be encountered is that there is no lift and a few stairs to get to the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great little find”
Reviews.Author: spearmint
Reviews.Content: Thanks to a previous couple who posted exact details of how to get from Marco Polo airport to our Vaporetto water stop. 13 euros. Took a lot of worry and anxiety away when your in a foreign country. As we were arriving quite late in the evening. Also thanks to the hotel for e-mailing exact details how to get to the hotel Ala to check in from the water stop. All very efficient. This room we had at the Favaro was just what you needed. Quiet, comfy. Plenty of towels. Bed made up every day. Very clean. We had to take our own kettle and cups for our much needed cuppa's after walking around so much during the day. There was a fridge in the room. No supermarket to buy milk though. Would have liked a safe in the room to lock valuables away during the day, but if you have a combination lock on your suitcase, thats good enough. Breakfast at the Ala hotel is only continental, but still good. No fry- ups there. It will cost you 10 euros per person. Eating out is very expensive too. Just a small meal for two without bread or drinks will set you back 40 euros for two people. Very limited menus's. Its either Past, Pizza or Fish. I had a salad, lettuce, tomato and few sweet corn, presented in a bowl the size of a cereal bowl. 9 euros. ( what ) Public toilets plenty around Saint Marks square. That will cost you 1-50 euros. Trying to find a toilet anywhere else is difficult. The restaurants are i'm sorry to say very un friendly. You have to buy a drink or they will not let you use their facilities. So then when you have had your drink and a visit to the loo, you want to go again. If you move away from the tourist areas it becomes a bit better. We did find a restaurant, and they were lovely having said all that. Go across the Rialto bridge and just wander around the other parts of Venice. Much prettier. You will get lost, but you are never far away from anything. So dont panic. There are yellow signs if you look up on the street walls, and they will direct you back to where you need to go. Well worth going away from the typical tourist areas. Look out for the Gondolla near the Acedemia bridge. It will only cost you 50 cents to cross from one side of the grand canal to the other. Great value. Just walk and get lost. Its the best way to see the typical Venice. Would recommed the Favaro for a short stay. Its quite near St.Marks square, but 2 doors down an alley way which is very quiet, You have to use a credit type card to get into the front door, which is very secure by the way. Happy holidays

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: PaulMo73
Reviews.Content: An absolute gem, easy to find if you can read a map and follow it, quiet but right in the middle of where you want to be. Rooms are spotless, shower and bathroom too and for Venice quite large. We had a keycard for the front door and the room. These are more like serviced apartments and ideal for a private getaway with all that you need...a bedroom and a bathroom. If you want someone in a uniform to hold the door open then this is not for you..if you want clean, central rooms, with help at the end of a phone if you want it and fantastic value for money then come to Residenza Favaro. I will be staying here again and would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Peripatetic007
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, minutes away from St Marks Square. Locating it could be tricky. I was very grateful for the directions left by other reviewers. Hotel is in side street where Bulgari store is, along Calle Largo XXII Marzo (Teatro Fenice area). Tidy, compact room w excellent bathroom, fridge, tv, air con. Quiet location in side street. Staff very friendlyl. Note that it's a serviced room-there's not hotel facilities, like reception desk etc. However, the staff are located in nearby hotel & available & very helpful. But, this suited me well-who needs all the hotel trappings?? Good value for money. Would gladly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JENALTOM
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very cute, not spacious, nice bathroom. It's conveniently located near St. Mark's Square. We had some difficulties finding it, but it's on the corner of Blvgari store. The sister hotel is Hotel Ala if you're arriving after 6pm. It was quiet, and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Tidy little hotel tucked away up side street”
Reviews.Author: raisciortino
Reviews.Content: Believe it or not during my time in Italy over the last 12 days, thi shotel has been my favourite and it is only a self catering 1 or 2 star rated residence up a side street a stones throw from Sain Marks square. The room is spacious well presente dan very clean and fresh. Basic but it has ll the tools you l need. Th eair con is ubber powerful and remains on when you leave the room. We were slpa bang in the middle of one of italys most expansive cities and this little number is that little black dress your wife keeps a secret because its a gem! You have your room only and thats it. The location is amazing right in designer central heaven. Travel to and from the mainland is very simple and easy to and not far from our lodgings. Decent hotel manager and clean place!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: janu007
Reviews.Content: WE had a great stay, 2 nights only at the end of May. THe location is really perfect, the rooms are quiet and very clean. Would definitely recommend to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Graham-Nikki
Reviews.Content: Excellent customer service, very clean rooms, bed made daily, towels changed daily. perfect situation for all amenities, cannot fault this hotel in any way shape or form, IF... i ever go back to Venice i would consider this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: San1976
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. The location was just perfect. Near to a vaparetto stop and near San Marco. The room was beautiful and clean. With every day new towels, airco and a nice bed. we would definitly go back to this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: VirginieVirginie
Reviews.Content: Residenza Favaro is located just off the classy Via XXII, 2 min walk from st mark's quare.Cool place.English and French spoken,Air conditionned,quiet,nice bathroom,comfy bed. Enjoy! Virginie Ars-Marini, France.

HotelInfo.Name: Residenza Favaro
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco 2259, 30124 Venice, Italy
